context: The word 'löögi' is the genitive case of the Estonian noun 'löök', which means a strike, blow, or hit. It refers to the forceful impact made by something hitting another object or person. In Estonian grammar, this form would typically be used in contexts where something belongs to or comes from the strike - for example, 'the power of the strike' (löögi jõud) or 'the result of the strike' (löögi tagajärg).
